intro: Psephellus freynii, commonly known as the Freyn's sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Psephellus freynii is often found in coastal dunes and other dry, open habitats.
